title: Strengthen primary CTA hierarchy in hero
description: Increase contrast and visual prominence of the primary hero action while preserving the minimalist visual direction.
rationale: The hero currently has subtle controls and low-contrast tertiary supporting text, which weakens first-click confidence.
current_state: Hero CTA group appears compact and visually close in weight; secondary action can compete with primary at a glance.
proposed_change: Increase primary CTA weight (size/padding and contrast), add stronger hover/focus token treatment, and reduce secondary CTA visual emphasis by one step.
user_benefit: Users identify the main next step faster and make fewer hesitant interactions.
acceptance_criteria: Primary CTA is visibly dominant over secondary CTA in default state
Primary CTA has distinct hover and focus-visible states
Secondary CTA remains discoverable but clearly secondary

subtasks.title: Tune hero CTA spacing and contrast
subtasks.description: Adjust CTA layout and visual tokens in hero section.
acceptance_criteria: CTA spacing follows existing token scale
Contrast remains WCAG AA compliant

title: Improve top-nav orientation and active-state clarity
description: Add clearer active/hover affordances in the marketing header navigation.
rationale: Current nav has minimal differentiation and limited wayfinding cues for where the user is.
current_state: Header shows sparse links with very subtle interaction cues.
proposed_change: Introduce explicit active-link styling (underline/bar or tokenized text shift), expand hover area to 40px+ tap-friendly targets, and preserve current aesthetic.
user_benefit: Users orient more quickly and can navigate with less uncertainty.
acceptance_criteria: Current route is visually distinguishable in nav
Hover and focus-visible states are visible on each nav item
Clickable area is comfortably tappable on touch devices

title: Reduce cookie banner obstruction on mobile
description: Compress the cookie banner footprint and avoid overlap with bottom UI elements on small screens.
rationale: The fixed cookie bar consumes meaningful vertical space and competes with other bottom overlays.
current_state: Cookie controls remain fixed at bottom with dense controls while hero content is in view.
proposed_change: Introduce compact mobile variant: one-line message + single 'Manage' action with expandable controls; preserve full control set in expanded mode.
user_benefit: Less visual obstruction and easier reading/interaction on first visit.
acceptance_criteria: Mobile banner occupies less vertical space by default
All consent actions remain reachable in expanded state
No overlap with persistent bottom UI elements

subtasks.title: Add compact mobile cookie-banner layout
subtasks.description: Implement collapsed/expanded interaction model under mobile breakpoints.
acceptance_criteria: Collapsed mode is default on small screens
Expanded mode exposes Reject/Customize/Accept actions

title: Clarify hero search action affordance
description: Make the Spotify search field's completion behavior clearer with explicit action affordances.
rationale: Input-only flow can feel ambiguous (search vs submit vs redirect), especially for first-time users.
current_state: Field uses icon and dynamic dropdown, but no explicit submit action or explanatory helper near control.
proposed_change: Add a tokenized trailing action label/button (e.g., 'Continue') when input is valid, plus concise helper text for expected behavior.
user_benefit: Users understand what happens next and recover from uncertainty faster.
acceptance_criteria: Valid input presents a clear actionable next step
Search, URL-paste, and continue flows remain keyboard-accessible
Error/empty guidance remains visible and concise

title: Tighten mobile typography and vertical rhythm
description: Rebalance hero text scale and spacing for handheld readability.
rationale: On mobile capture, heading and supporting text stack feels dense while below-the-fold spacing becomes sparse/empty.
current_state: Very small visual content block at top with large uninterrupted dark sections below.
proposed_change: Adjust mobile hero min-height/padding and use responsive text tokens so first screen balances headline, subcopy, CTA, and immediate continuation content.
user_benefit: Improved scannability and stronger perceived polish on mobile devices.
acceptance_criteria: Hero content fills first viewport more intentionally on 375x812
Line lengths remain readable without crowding
No excessive dead vertical space before next content section

title: Replace blank dashboard wait with content skeleton
description: Ensure dashboard loading states show structure, not an empty canvas + spinner.
rationale: The captured app dashboard state shows a mostly empty page with central spinner, which feels stalled and uninformative.
current_state: Users can land on a sparse white dashboard area with loading spinner and little context.
proposed_change: Use section-aware skeleton blocks and contextual loading text for dashboard panels while data resolves.
user_benefit: Higher trust and lower perceived wait time.
acceptance_criteria: Loading state shows placeholder structure matching final layout
No blank full-page canvas while loading
Loading transitions avoid layout jumps

subtasks.title: Audit route-level loading fallbacks
subtasks.description: Confirm all dashboard routes use skeletons over generic spinners.
acceptance_criteria: Each dashboard route has content-matched loading state

title: Standardize focus-visible style between primitives and marketing links
description: Apply consistent focus-visible treatment to custom links/buttons that bypass shared primitives.
rationale: UI primitives include robust focus rings, but some hand-authored marketing links use custom classes with weaker focus consistency.
current_state: Focus styling varies by surface and is less predictable in marketing-specific custom controls.
proposed_change: Extract and apply a shared focus utility/token class for all interactive marketing controls, including in-hero links and dropdown options.
user_benefit: Improved keyboard navigation confidence and consistent accessibility affordances.
acceptance_criteria: All interactive controls show visible focus ring at keyboard focus
Focus appearance is visually consistent across nav, hero CTA, and dropdown
No regression to pointer-only interaction cues

title: Improve low-contrast tertiary copy on dark hero
description: Increase readability of tertiary text in key first-view surfaces.
rationale: Small tertiary copy under the hero and in utility links is difficult to read against dark backgrounds at mobile scale.
current_state: Tertiary text is used in small font sizes where perceived contrast drops on handheld screens.
proposed_change: Use secondary text token for critical helper text and reserve tertiary token for non-critical metadata; optionally bump tertiary token lightness slightly for small text usage.
user_benefit: Better readability and reduced eye strain, especially on mobile.
acceptance_criteria: Body/help text in first viewport meets or exceeds WCAG AA contrast
Critical explanatory copy is not rendered using weakest contrast token
Visual hierarchy is preserved after contrast adjustments

title: Introduce actionable empty-state messaging in app shell
description: Add contextual empty-state guidance with clear next actions for dashboard areas that can appear blank.
rationale: A mostly blank dashboard frame can feel broken without explanation, even when data is simply unavailable or still resolving.
current_state: Blank frame with spinner provides minimal context and no immediate user action.
proposed_change: Add explicit empty/loading copy with route-aware CTA (e.g., 'Create your first release', 'Complete profile', 'Retry').
user_benefit: Users understand why content is missing and what to do next.
acceptance_criteria: Empty or no-data states include one clear primary action
Message explains why the panel is empty in plain language
State is distinguishable from error and loading

title: Unify token usage between marketing surfaces and base theme
description: Reduce mixed use of base-theme classes and linear token styles in the same hero surfaces.
rationale: Current marketing views mix `bg-base`/tokenized utility classes with explicit linear variables, creating visual inconsistencies across breakpoints and themes.
current_state: Some sections inherit marketing dark shell while local blocks still use base theme classes and mixed token families.
proposed_change: Define a small marketing semantic token layer (text/bg/border/interactive) and migrate hero/header controls to that layer consistently.
user_benefit: More cohesive visual identity and fewer edge-case style regressions.
acceptance_criteria: Marketing hero and header use one consistent token system
No mixed semantic drift between base and linear token classes in the same surface
Visual output remains consistent across desktop and mobile

subtasks.title: Create marketing semantic token aliases
subtasks.description: Add semantic aliases for marketing text/background/interactive states and migrate primary hero controls.
acceptance_criteria: Hero and header rely on semantic aliases rather than ad-hoc token picks
No visual regressions in existing marketing snapshots
